intro: Dichiloboea strobilacea, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its compact growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
